result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments (TRO/INJCT)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

Absolute sobriety.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary  by the probation agent.

Complete Batterers Intervention class.
Mental health assessment and cooperate with any programs recommended by the probation agent.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Perry

Defendant Jerome Perry in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Jerome Perry in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerome Perry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
